body.name: D-Link Wireless AC Smart Beam 1750 Mbps Home Cloud App-Enabled Dual-Band Gigabit Router (DIR-866L)
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Saturday, February 17. Order within 13 hrs 13 mins
features: Backward compatible with your wireless devices
Enhanced coverage with AC smart Beam technology and high-powered Amplifier
Connect four of your devices with Gigabit Ethernet connectivity
Stream and share your files with mydlink share port
Remote Access: Remote access for network management in the palm of your hand with the free mydlink lite mobile app
Media Sharing: Wirelessly access your favorite media from a connected USB storage drive with the free mydlink Share Port app
Coverage: Designed with a high-powered amplifier to provide wireless coverage to every corner of home
Performance: Performance with wireless AC1750 and four Gigabit Ethernet ports
Easy Setup: Intelligent setup using web browser wizard or with the free Quick Router Setup (QRS) mobile app
Share Port Plus: Easily share printers, USB storage devices and multi-function devices
body.description: The Wireless AC1750 Dual Band Gigabit Cloud Router (DIR-866L) gives you a superior 11AC experience with wireless speeds of up to 1.7 Gbps, AC Smart Beam technology, Gigabit Ethernet and Advanced QoS to efficiently distribute bandwidth. The DIR-866L is mydlink-enabled, so you can effortlessly access and view your network from your smartphone or tablet. It's also mydlink Cloud enabled and supports the mydlink Share Port app so you can create your own personal storage by connecting any USB storage drive to the DIR-866L to stream and share your media files.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: DIR-866L: AC1750 Wi-Fi Router Wireless speeds of up to 1750 Mbps (450Mbps on 2.4GHz + 1300Mbps on 5GHz)

Key Features AC1750 Speeds Next Generation 11AC Wi-Fi AC1750 speeds for a really fast home network. Intelligent Bandwidth Distributes traffic using band steering technology for superior Wi-Fi performance. Easy Setup Get online in minutes with our quick router setup (QRS) app. Share Your Stuff Use our free mydlink SharePort app to stream and share pictures, videos, and more to your mobile devices.

A More Powerful Router With more and more devices in the household, it's time you got a router that can provide all of the speed and coverage you need. Multiplayer gaming, HD streaming, file transfers, video chat, email, web surfing – you can do it all with the AC1750 Wi-Fi Router.

Why 11AC? AC means doing what you love on all your devices. Watch a movie. Game without lag. Upload pictures of your cat. Whatever you're into, AC Wi-Fi has your back. Remote Management Monitor your network no matter where you are. See who is connected to your router, change settings, or block someone from using your network connection. mydlink Lite app - available for iPhone, iPad, Android and Windows Phone devices. Access and Share Files From Anywhere Plug in a USB storage device and instantly create your own personal cloud storage for playing your media files remotely using a smartphone or tablet. mydlink SharePort app - available for iPhone, iPad and Android devices.

Multi-tasking is a Breeze with Dual Band Technology Use the 2.4 GHz band for everyday tasks, while leaving the high-speed 5 GHz AC band free for HD video streaming, online gaming and large file transfers. With fewer devices using the high-speed 5 GHz band, there's less interference and congestion, giving you better performance and a lag-free wireless experience.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It does what I wanted it to do.
reviews.reviewText: One thing. I put it too close to my subwoofer and the RF interfered. Had to place it at least 3' from my sub woofer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I like the quality for the price!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Bad support and product doesn't work as described.
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this as a result of the cloud security. The strength is weak. Two door bell cameras have issues. I then got 4 different extenders 2 by d link and two by NETGEAR. Neither extenders mattered. I had an hp printer that would show connected and print via cell and tablet however not by an Windows 10 laptop.I checked but a few weeks out of return. The was button has never worked. I contacted support and got of course a barely English speaking person. He after getting all information said he doesn't know anything about routers and printing. He then asked if I wanted a case number and I said no what good is it.Amazon did refund the purchase. The other extenders were returned for refund.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very good router
reviews.reviewText: Easy to set up and connect to devices. No issues with it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This added another layer of protection and let the DI-624 handle all the crap network traffic (such as port scanning)
reviews.reviewText: My first D-Link wireless router was a DI-624 that I purchased about 10 years ago. The wireless in the DI-624 started to drop connections, so a year ago I purchased a DIR-880L AC1900 to replace the DI-624's wireless capability. I moved the DI-624 in between the cable modem and the DIR-880L and disabled the wireless on the DI-624. This added another layer of protection and let the DI-624 handle all the crap network traffic (such as port scanning). Well, my faithful DI-624 died. So, I purchased the DIR-866L to replace it. Might be overkill, but I love the granularity of the user interface and configuration options. Very satisfied.1/2/2016 update: My DAP-1650 (wireless access point extender) connects to my DIR-880L via 2.5GHz and 5GHz with no issues. My DIR-880L connects to my DIR-866L via wired Ethernet. My DIR-866L connects to my cable modem. No dropped connections or router reboots from any of these three devices. Been running like a champ for three days, now.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars I mainly wanted an easy and automated way to back up and stream the ...
reviews.reviewText: I bought this for cloud storage as an alternative to building or buying a NAS. I mainly wanted an easy and automated way to back up and stream the media from my various tablets and smartphone. I have to say i am dissapointed. It Won't work with my external hard drive even though it is a 1 terabyte nfsa file format. It works fine with my mom's external hard drive though. My hard drive works fine on the netgear ac1750. Range is ok. Speed is good though. Also the my share port app for Android is abysmal for cloud storage. It is more designed to stream with. Clunky interface, slow, and kind of complex for what I wanted to do with it. The netgear ac1750 with two USB ports is a much better bang for your buck. It has 1 usb 2.0 for a network printer and a usb 3.0 for an external HD. The Netgear cloud app for Android is much better designed and has options to automatically back up your pictures and videos, which is exactly what I wanted with this router. I have no experience with this router and the dlink webcams, maybe that's where it could shine. But as a personal cloud I don't recommend this dlink. Go with netgear instead.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great for the price.
reviews.reviewText: Great router for the money. It was one of the best in 2014 when it first came out and still is in 2017. The web based UI is better on the eyes than even older Linksys routers I've used. The auto scan for the best channels to broadcast is good for those that don't know what that's about and have a lot of other WiFi close by like in an apartment complex, duplex, etc.However, I still manually changed my 2.4 channel to get it to -48dBm. For those that don't know -50 is ideal. Anyways, I suggest this for those with some tech knowledge, patience, or both. Don't buy this for your grandma or those that need plug and play. This was mostly plug and play but WiFi needing some tweaking. No firmware updates were available. I would definitely buy again. It was $60 and increased all download speeds wired and wireless by 10Mbps per device.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2021
reviews.reviewText: Great - no issues. Set it up and never worried about it. Used to extend wifi only to master bedroom. Bought for <50.00 in April 2018, still going strong and has survived several falls also.
La mejor opción calidad/precio para una conexión mas que perfecta y constante.mi internet era insoportable antes de adquirir este dispositivo.
